snippet: The president’s visit to Michigan is part of an effort that has seen most of the action on worker pay move to the states.
abstract: Pres Obama's visit to University of Michigan is part of a push to generate political pressure for raising the federal minimum wage; seven states and the District of Columbia have raised their own minimum wages since Obama called for a wage increase in his 2013 State of the Union address; 34 states have begun legislative debates on the matter.
lead_paragraph: The president’s visit to Michigan is part of an effort that has seen most of the action on worker pay move to the states.

headline.main: After Push by Obama, Minimum-Wage Action Is Moving to the States
headline.print_headline: After Push by Obama, Minimum-Wage Action Is Moving to the States
